content: gift bags that keep on giving by jen spears crocheter of awesome i like giving gift bags with my gifts sturdy and tight construction means there s no need for additional lining… and i m all for that this pattern uses single_crochet single_crochet on both sides of the foundation chain increases decreases and back loop only tutorials for crocheting into the ridge loop and how to make the various types of single_crochet stitches can be found at the crocheters of awesome blog this pattern can be easily resized chain 16 or 21 and adjust height rounds accordingly or chain 31 36 41 for a tote my experience is that anything larger than 30 may be too heavy to stand up on its own it will still work great as a bag but you may not get that gift bag look for this pattern i used 200-250 yards worsted yarn sturdy worsteds works better than soft worsteds h/i hook or whatever you need for a firm but comfortable fabric step by step chain 26 round 1 single_crochet in the back ridge loop of second chain from hook and each remaining chain 25 single_crochet at this point do not turn rotate it 180 degrees clockwise and and single_crochet in the back side of each chain place stitch marker in first single_crochet do not turn or join 50 single_crochet total round 2 3sc in first single_crochet single_crochet to last stitch on first side and 3sc to make second corner 3sc in next stitch first stitch on second side to make third corner single_crochet to last stitch on second side and 3sc to make fourth corner place markers in center stitch of each corner and move them up each round round 3 *single_crochet to corner 3 single_crochet in corner single_crochet* repeat from * to * to marker round 4 - 6 repeat round 3 round 7 in back loops only - single_crochet to the 3sc corner of previous row decrease single_crochet over those three stitches insert hook in next single_crochet pull up a loop - 3 times yo and pull through all loops *single_crochet to next corner decrease single_crochet over 3 stitches* repeat from * to * to marker you can see how the corners square off the bottom and begins to shape the bag rounds 8 - 30 remove all markers single_crochet evenly around round 31 handles lay bag flat out so bottom is even working in the round has probably skewed your top corners from your original mark but that s ok place markers in the top corners single_crochet to first marker if needed begin handle by single_crochet for 14 stitches chain 12 skip 13 and work into next stitch single_crochet for 28 stitches skip 13 and work into next stitch single_crochet to marker r 32 single_crochet to chain 12 single_crochet over chain single_crochet around to next handle 12 single_crochet over chain single_crochet to marker rounds 33 - 36 single_crochet evenly around fasten_off for a nice finishing touch that helps to stabilize
